body:
I just tried shutting down bitcoin-qt using the 'stop' RPC. It hung.

I built from a recent master branch commit 99bc0b428b03b571afbc311b7f18fd3a707ac5af with a couple of @laanwj's debugging commits (see [here](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/11355#issuecomment-345052036)) merged in.

Here's are the stack traces:

    (gdb) thread apply all where

    Thread 10 (Thread 0x7f5dd77ae700 (LWP 20622)):
    #0  0x00007f5e427476ad in poll () at ../sysdeps/unix/syscall-template.S:84
    #1  0x00007f5e4007e9f6 in ?? () from /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libglib-2.0.so.0
    #2  0x00007f5e4007eb0c in g_main_context_iteration () from /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libglib-2.0.so.0
    #3  0x00007f5e44d0f04f in QEventDispatcherGlib::processEvents (this=0x7f5dc80008c0, flags=...) at kernel/qeventdispatcher_glib.cpp:423
    #4  0x00007f5e44cb89ca in QEventLoop::exec (this=this@entry=0x7f5dd77adcc0, flags=..., flags@entry=...) at kernel/qeventloop.cpp:212
    #5  0x00007f5e44ae60f3 in QThread::exec (this=<optimized out>) at thread/qthread.cpp:507
    #6  0x00007f5e44aeada8 in QThreadPrivate::start (arg=0x55692e0ccb10) at thread/qthread_unix.cpp:368

    #8  0x00007f5e42750aff in clone () at ../sysdeps/unix/sysv/linux/x86_64/clone.S:97

    Thread 9 (Thread 0x7f5dfbfff700 (LWP 20605)):

    #2  leveldb::(anonymous namespace)::PosixEnv::BGThreadWrapper (arg=<optimized out>) at leveldb/util/env_posix.cc:564
    #3  0x00007f5e441a8494 in start_thread (arg=0x7f5dfbfff700) at pthread_create.c:333

title: deadlock on shutdown
